--- # TITLE & AUTHOR title: "Diss" subtitle: "Current Status" author: "Joschka Schwarz" institute: "Hamburg University of Technology" date: today date-format: "dddd, D[th] [of] MMMM YYYY" section-divs: true filters: - lightbox lightbox: auto --- ## Table of Contents {data-state="hide-menubar"}
      # Topics {data-stack-name="Topics"} ## Possible Overarching Topics * Bricolage and effectuation * Technical Entrepreneur (prior knowledge) * Contingency * Novelty and Technological uncertainty * Knowledge spillover We are interested in how actors are influenced by and interact with their social and cultural environments to bring about novelty, e.g. with regard to ideas, teams, products or business practices. # Data sources {data-stack-name="Intro"} ## Research Scope ```{=html}

       

      W-11 Research Focus & Fields

      We are interested in how actors are influenced by and interact with their social and cultural environments to bring about novelty, e.g. with regard to ideas, teams, products or business practices.

      ``` # Data sources {data-stack-name="Data"} ## Step1: Identity matching Linking Developer with startup data ::: {.absolute top=30% left=10% width=80%} ![](img/data_sources_v2.svg) ::: # Data GH {data-stack-name="Data I"} ## GitHub: 1. GHTorrent and 2. Github API ::: {.panel-tabset} ### 1. Schema ::: {.absolute top=20% left=10% width=80%} ![](img/ghtorrent_schema.png) ::: ### 2. Conn ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} p_load(RMariaDB, dplyr) con <- dbConnect( drv = MariaDB(), dbname = "ghtorrent_restore", username = "ghtorrentuser", password = Sys.getenv("GHTORRENTPASSWORD"), # <1> host = "127.0.0.1", # <2> port = 3307 # <2> ) con |> dbListTables() ``` ::: 1. Password is located in a `.Renviron` file that is not stored in version control (GitHub) 2. SSH port forwarding/tunneling for MySQL connection is used ::::: {.fragment} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="33%"} ::: {.cell output-location='fragment'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl(con, "users") |> count() ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} ::: {.cell output-location='fragment'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl(con,"projects") |> count() ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="33%"} ::: {.cell output-location='fragment'} ```{.r .cell-code} tbl(con,"project_commits") |> count() ``` ::: ::: :::: ::::: ### 3. User (GHT) GHTorrent user data does not contain much valuable information: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} users <- tbl(con, "users") users |> glimpse() ``` ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} users |> filter(login == "christophihl") |> glimpse() ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ### 4. User (Website) :::: {.absolute top="20%"} ::: {style="text-align: center"} ![](img/github_user.png){width=80% height=80%} ::: :::: ::: {.fragment .fade-up fragment-index=1} ::: {.absolute top="10.5em" left="20%"}        ![](img/checkmark1.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-up fragment-index=1} ::: {.absolute top="13.5em" left="20%"}        ![](img/checkmark2.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-up fragment-index=1} ::: {.absolute top="14.5em" left="20%"}        ![](img/checkmark1.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-up fragment-index=1} ::: {.absolute top="17em" left="20%"}        ![](img/checkmark2.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-down fragment-index=2} ::: {.absolute top="16.5em" left="35%"}        ![](img/cross1.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-down fragment-index=2} ::: {.absolute top="16em" left="35%"}        ![](img/cross2.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-down fragment-index=2} ::: {.absolute top="10.5em" left="35%"}        ![](img/cross1.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-down fragment-index=3} ::: {.absolute top="10em" left="35%"}        ![](img/cross2.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-down fragment-index=2} ::: {.absolute top="6em" left="35%"}        ![](img/cross1.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-right fragment-index=3} ::: {.absolute top="0" left="0" style="font-size: 0.5rem;"} [https://github.com/jspolsky](https://github.com/jspolsky){target="_blank"} ::: ::: ### 5. User (API) More sensible data via API: Name, Email, Avatar, Blog/URL, Bio :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} *Single API Request* ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="|1|2"} httr::GET("https://api.github.com/users/christophihl") httr::GET("https://api.github.com/user/8004978") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{.cell-out-height} #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 28 #> $ login "christophihl" #> $ id 8004978 #> $ node_id "MDQ6VXNlcjgwMDQ5Nzg=" #> $ avatar_url "https://avatars.githu… #> $ gravatar_id "" #> $ url "https://api.github.co… #> $ html_url "https://github.com/ch… #> $ followers_url "https://api.github.co… #> $ following_url "https://api.github.co… #> $ gists_url "https://api.github.co… #> $ starred_url "https://api.github.co… #> $ subscriptions_url "https://api.github.co… #> $ organizations_url "https://api.github.co… #> $ repos_url "https://api.github.co… #> $ events_url "https://api.github.co… #> $ received_events_url "https://api.github.co… #> $ type "User" #> $ site_admin FALSE #> $ name "Christoph Ihl" #> $ company "Hamburg University of… #> $ blog "www.startupengineer.i… #> $ location "Hamburg" #> $ public_repos 19 #> $ public_gists 1 #> $ followers 11 #> $ following 1 #> $ created_at "2014-06-27T11:22:22Z" #> $ updated_at "2023-02-23T12:51:45Z" ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.fragment} *Final API dataset* ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} open_dataset("gh_api_users_wrangled.parquet") |> glimpse() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{.cell-out-height} #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file #> 42,557,276 rows x 16 columns #> $ id 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, … #> $ login "mojombo", "def… #> $ type > User, User, Use… #> $ site_admin > FALSE, TRUE, FA… #> $ name "Tom Preston-We… #> $ company NA, "@github ",… #> $ blog "http://tom.pre… #> $ location "San Francisco"… #> $ email "tom@mojombo.co… #> $ email_hash "25c7c18223fb42… #> $ bio NA, "🍔 ", NA, … #> $ public_repos 60, 107, 8, 207… #> $ public_gists 62, 273, 21, 74… #> $ followers 21141, 20355, 8… #> $ following 11, 210, 30, 4,… #> $ created_at 2007-10-20 05:2… #> Call `print()` for full schema details ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: :::: ### 6. Orgs Two different types: Organizations and User accounts :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="55%"} ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} httr::GET("https://api.github.com/users/TUHHStartupEngineers") httr::GET("https://api.github.com/user/30825260") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> Rows: 1 #> Columns: 29 #> $ login "TUHHStartupEngineers" #> $ id 30825260 #> $ node_id "MDEyOk9yZ2FuaXphdGlvbjMwODI1M… #> $ avatar_url "https://avatars.githubusercon… #> $ gravatar_id "" #> $ url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ html_url "https://github.com/TUHHStartu… #> $ followers_url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ following_url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ gists_url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ starred_url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ subscriptions_url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ organizations_url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ repos_url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ events_url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ received_events_url "https://api.github.com/users/… #> $ type "Organization" #> $ site_admin FALSE #> $ name "TUHH Institute of Entrepreneu… #> $ blog "www.startupengineer.io" #> $ location "Hamburg University of Technol… #> $ email "startup.engineer@tuhh.de" #> $ bio "Data Science, Research & Prac… #> $ public_repos 72 #> $ public_gists 0 #> $ followers 6 #> $ following 0 #> $ created_at "2017-08-08T07:40:56Z" #> $ updated_at "2022-12-03T09:45:36Z" ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="45%"} ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} org_members <- tbl(con, "organization_members") org_members ``` ::: ::: {.cell output-location='fragment'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="4"} org_members |> left_join(users, by = c(org_id = "id")) |> left_join(users, by = c(user_id = "id")) |> filter(login.x == "TUHHStartupEngineers") |> select(login.y) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: ::: :::: ### 7. Merged :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} 1. Organization affiliation: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gh_org_affil <- org_members |> # Logins for users & orgs (via GHT) left_join(gh_ght_users, by = c(org_id = "id")) |> left_join(gh_ght_users, by = c(user_id = "id")) |> # Domains for orgs (via API) left_join(gh_api_users, by = c(org_login = "login")) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{.hscroll} #> # A tibble: 929,893 × 5 #> ght_usr_id usr_login ght_org_id org_login org_domain #> #> 1 1 tosch 76303 Sage sage.com #> 2 1 tosch 242944 ruote ruote.rubyforge.org #> 3 2 jmettraux 28935 rightscale blog.rightscale.com #> 4 2 jmettraux 242944 ruote ruote.rubyforge.org #> 5 2 jmettraux 242945 tlug tlug.jp #> 6 2 jmettraux 242951 hiroshimarb hiroshimarb.github.com #> 7 2 jmettraux 3070986 flon-io flon.io #> 8 2 jmettraux 30939037 floraison #> 9 4 kennethkalmer 2192 collectiveidea collectiveidea.com #> 10 4 kennethkalmer 33223 platform45 platform45.com #> 11 4 kennethkalmer 242944 ruote ruote.rubyforge.org #> 12 4 kennethkalmer 258042 InternetSolutions #> 13 4 kennethkalmer 7313333 ValuationUp valuationup.com #> 14 4 kennethkalmer 7313335 zero-one-software zero-one.io #> 15 4 kennethkalmer 11080227 zadevchat zadevchat.io #> 16 4 kennethkalmer 11415454 MyLightstone #> 17 4 kennethkalmer 62779848 imilingo #> 18 5 weppos 10634 fog fog.io #> # ℹ 929,875 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} 2. Final dataset: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} gh_api_users |> # Add org memberships (+ domains) left_join(gh_org_affil) |> # Add location data left_join(gh_ght_users) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{.hscroll} #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file #> 42,882,992 rows x 19 columns #> $ api_usr_id 1, 1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, 4, … #> $ ght_usr_id 9236, 9236, 1570, 1570, 13256, 3892,… #> $ login "mojombo", "mojombo", "defunkt", "de… #> $ type > User, User, User, User, User, User, … #> $ name "Tom Preston-Werner", "Tom Preston-W… #> $ company NA, NA, "@github ", "@github ", "Git… #> $ blog "http://tom.preston-werner.com", "ht… #> $ email "tom@mojombo.com", "tom@mojombo.com"… #> $ email_hash "25c7c18223fb42a4c6ae1c8db6f50f9b", … #> $ bio NA, NA, "🍔 ", "🍔 ", NA, NA, NA, NA… #> $ ght_org_id 142, 4417198, 142, 105208, 142, 3797… #> $ org_login "github", "toml-lang", "github", "mu… #> $ org_domain "github.com/about", NA, "github.com/… #> $ member_created_at 2012-08-06 16:41:31, 2018-09-27 23:4… #> $ location "San Francisco", "San Francisco", "S… #> $ country_code > US, US, NA, NA, us, US, US, US, US, … #> $ state "CA", "CA", NA, NA, "San Francisco C… #> $ city "San Francisco", "San Francisco", NA… #> $ usr_created_at 2007-10-20 05:24:19, 2007-10-20 05:2… #> Call `print()` for full schema details ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ::: # Data SO {data-stack-name="Data II"} ## Stackoverflow ::: {.panel-tabset} ### Overview * Two among the most widely adopted and studied platforms are **GitHub** and **StackOverflow** * These two platforms serve *different purposes*: code sharing and collaborative development vs. information and knowledge exchange. * At the same time, they both serve potentially the *same community* of developers for the same overall goal, i.e., software development. ### Dumps :::::: {.r-stack} ::::: {.fragment .fade-out fragment-index=2} ::: {.cell} ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} open_dataset("so_dump_2021_09_users.parquet") |> glimpse() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file (query) #> 15,538,940 rows x 11 columns #> $ Id 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, … #> $ Reputation 61327, 5870, 15446, 32650… #> $ DisplayName "Jeff Atwood", "Geoff Dal… #> $ AboutMe "

      $ Views 587263, 29947, 28149, 817… #> $ UpVotes 3390, 670, 7912, 855, 789… #> $ DownVotes 1311, 88, 100, 100, 34, 9… #> $ WebsiteUrl "https://blog.codinghorro… #> $ Location "El Cerrito, CA", "Corval… #> $ AccountId 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 5… #> $ ProfileImageUrl NA, "https://i.stack.imgu… #> Call `print()` for query details ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.fragment fragment-index=1} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} open_dataset("so_dump_2021_09_users.parquet") |> filter(DisplayName == "Christoph Ihl") glimpse() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file (query) #> 1 rows x 11 columns #> $ Id 9882371 #> $ Reputation 1 #> $ DisplayName "Christoph Ihl" #> $ AboutMe NA #> $ Views 28 #> $ UpVotes 0 #> $ DownVotes 0 #> $ WebsiteUrl "https://startupengineer.… #> $ Location "Hamburg, Germany" #> $ AccountId 13695600 #> $ ProfileImageUrl "https://graph.facebook.c… #> Call `print()` for query details ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: :::: ::::: ::::: {.fragment .fade-in-then-out fragment-index=2} ::: {.cell} ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="100%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} open_dataset("so_dump_2013_09_users.parquet") |> glimpse() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file (query) #> 2,332,402 rows x 11 columns #> $ Id 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13, 16, 17, 19, 20, 22, 23, 24, 25, 26, 27, 29, 30, 32, 33, … #> $ Reputation 27314, 1772, 7645, 20560, 25459, 943, 6693, 101, 782, 84938, 378, 27996, 539, 5475, 4772,… #> $ DisplayName "Jeff Atwood", "Geoff Dalgas", "Jarrod Dixon", "Joel Spolsky", "Jon Galloway", "Eggs McLa… #> $ AboutMe "

      St… #> $ Views 119303, 13331, 15913, 50749, 5997, 2902, 2325, 1748, 824, 10318, 470, 3143, 449, 994, 546… #> $ UpVotes 3177, 531, 4595, 730, 757, 12, 35, 0, 0, 3907, 35, 837, 33, 367, 151, 307, 219, 523, 557,… #> $ DownVotes 1297, 86, 82, 92, 34, 9, 4, 0, 0, 144, 1, 196, 10, 38, 5, 3, 2, 73, 64, 3, 168, 8, 1, 21,… #> $ WebsiteUrl "http://www.codinghorror.com/blog/", "http://stackoverflow.com", "http://stackoverflow.co… #> $ Location "El Cerrito, CA", "Corvallis, OR", "New York, NY", "New York, NY", "San Diego, CA", NA, "… #> $ Age 43, 36, 34, NA, 43, NA, 42, 34, NA, 33, 33, 33, 40, NA, 27, 27, 30, 33, 29, 30, 31, 29, 3… #> $ EmailHash "51d623f33f8b83095db84ff35e15dbe8", "b437f461b3fd27387c5d8ab47a293d35", "2dfa19bf5dc5826c… #> Call `print()` for query details ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ::::: ::::: {.fragment .fade-in fragment-index=3} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Stackoverflow knitr::include_graphics( "https://graph.facebook.com/920949401423102/picture?type=large" ) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](img/christoph.jpeg){width=50%} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # GitHub knitr::include_graphics( "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/8004978?v=4" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/8004978?v=4){width=50%} ::: ::: ::: :::: ::::: :::::: ::: {.cell} ::: ### Identity Matching :::::: {.r-stack} :::: {style="margin: 1em 0 0 0;"} ::: {.fragment .highlight-red fragment-index=1} ::: {.fragment .semi-fade-out fragment-index=2} ::: {.fragment .strike fragment-index=2} * Name ::: ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .highlight-red fragment-index=2} ::: {.fragment .semi-fade-out fragment-index=3} ::: {.fragment .strike fragment-index=3} * Name and Location ::: ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-out fragment-index=2} * Profile images ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-up fragment-index=3} ::: {.fragment .highlight-red fragment-index=3} * Profile images ::: ::: :::: ::::: {.fragment .fade-in-then-out fragment-index=2 style="margin-top: 6em;"} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} join <- open_dataset("gh_api_users.parquet") |> inner_join( open_dataset("so_users_joined.parquet") , by = c(name ="DisplayName", location = "Location"), na_matches = "never" ) |> compute() join|> nrow() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> [1] 724961 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} join |> filter(location == "Hamburg") |> count(name, sort = T) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> # A tibble: 43 × 2 #> name n #> #> 1 Jan 10 #> 2 Alex 8 #> 3 Chris 8 #> 4 Patrick 6 #> 5 Nils 5 #> 6 Fabian 4 #> 7 Dennis 3 #> # ℹ 36 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: Optimization: OpenStreetMap API and only full names ::::: :::::: ::::: {.fragment .fade-in fragment-index=3 style="margin-top: -11.5em;"} :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Stackoverflow knitr::include_graphics( "https://graph.facebook.com/920949401423102/picture?type=large" ) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](img/christoph.jpeg){width=50%} ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # GitHub knitr::include_graphics( "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/8004978?v=4" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/8004978?v=4){width=50%} ::: ::: ::: :::: ::::: ### Dump 2013 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} open_dataset("so_dump_2013_09_users.parquet") |> glimpse() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> FileSystemDataset with 1 Parquet file #> 2,332,402 rows x 13 columns #> $ Id 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13, 16, 17… #> $ Reputation 27314, 1772, 7645, 20560, 25459, 943, 6… #> $ CreationDate 2008-07-31 14:22:31, 2008-07-31 14:22:3… #> $ DisplayName "Jeff Atwood", "Geoff Dalgas", "Jarrod … #> $ LastAccessDate 2013-09-03 04:16:21, 2013-09-06 04:53:1… #> $ AboutMe "

      $ Views 119303, 13331, 15913, 50749, 5997, 2902… #> $ UpVotes 3177, 531, 4595, 730, 757, 12, 35, 0, 0… #> $ DownVotes 1297, 86, 82, 92, 34, 9, 4, 0, 0, 144, … #> $ WebsiteUrl "http://www.codinghorror.com/blog/", "h… #> $ Location "El Cerrito, CA", "Corvallis, OR", "New… #> $ Age 43, 36, 34, NA, 43, NA, 42, 34, NA, 33,… #> $ EmailHash "51d623f33f8b83095db84ff35e15dbe8", "b4… #> Call `print()` for full schema details ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Stackoverflow ::: {.absolute top="10%" left="0" width="100%" height="100%"} ::: {style="text-align: center"} ![](img/stackoverflow_user.png) ::: ::: http://stackoverflow.com/users/1/jeff-atwood ::: {.fragment .fade-up} ::: {.absolute top="2em" left="42%"}        ![](img/arrow-2.svg) ::: ::: ::: {.fragment .fade-up} ::: {.absolute top="6em" left="28%"}        ![](img/arrow-1.svg) ::: ::: . . . ::: {.absolute top="50%" left="10%"} ::: {style="color: #cc0000"} code *can* go here ::: ::: # Test {data-name="test"} ## Heading ```{=html} Fade in > Turn red > Fade out ``` ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} knitr::include_graphics("https://graph.facebook.com/920949401423102/picture?type=large") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](https://graph.facebook.com/920949401423102/picture?type=large) ::: ::: . . . - `revealjs` for Quarto is a framework for turning Pandoc-friendly markdown + code into beautiful slides - User guide: . . . ![](https://c.tenor.com/3EYd9ID79vcAAAAd/mic-drop-the-voice.gif){fig-align="center"} # Slide 1 {data-name="Regular slide"} A paragraph with some text and a [link](http://hakim.se). # Vertical slide 1 {data-stack-name="Vertical"} ## Vertical slide 2 # Global options {data-stack-name="Options"} The options below have user configurable options. In a regular Reveal.js presentation, these can be set through JavaScript, but Quarto makes it configurable through YAML options. ::: columns ::: {.column style="font-size: 2rem"} 1. menubarclass 2. menuclass 3. activeclass 4. activeelement ::: ::: {.column style="font-size: 2rem"} 5. barhtml 7. flat 8. scale ::: ::: ## Option 1: menubarclass The menubarclass option sets the classname of menubars. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: menubarclass: "menubar" ```

      Simplemenu will show the menubar(s) on all pages. If you do not want to show the menubar on certain pages, use data-state="hide-menubar" on that section. This behaviour also works when exporting to PDF using the Reveal.js ?print-pdf option.

      ## Option 2: menuclass The menuclass option sets the classname of the menu. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: menuclass: "menu" ``` Simplemenu looks inside this menu for list items (LI's). ## Option 3: activeclass The activeclass option is the class an active menuitem gets. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: activeclass: "active" ``` ## Option 4: activeelement The activeelement option sets the item that gets the active class. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: activeelement: "li" ``` You may want to change it to the anchor inside the li, like this: `activeelement: "a"`. ## Option 5: barhtml You can add the HTML for the header (and/or footer) through this option. This way you no longer need to edit the template. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: barhtml: header: "
        " footer: "" ``` ## Option 5: barhtml (Continued) You can also move the slide number or the controls to your header or footer. If they are nested there manually, or through the `barhtml` option, they will then display inside that header or footer. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: barhtml: header: "" footer: "
          " ``` ## Option 6: flat Sometimes you’ll want to limit your presentation to horizontal slides only. To still use ‘chapters’, you can use the `flat` option. By default, it is set to `false`, but you can set it to `true`. Then, when a data-name is set for a slide, any following slides will keep that menu name. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: flat: true ``` To stop inheriting the previous slide menu name, start a new named section, or add `data-sm="false"` to your slide. ## Option 7: scale When you have a lot of subjects/chapters in your menubar, they might not all fit in a row. You can then tweak the scale in the options. Simplemenu copies the Reveal.js (slide) scaling and adds a `scale` option on top of that. ``` yaml format: revealjs: ... simplemenu: scale: 0.67 ``` It is set to be two-thirds of the main scaling. # More demos {data-name="More demos"} For more demos go to the [Simplemenu plugin](https://github.com/Martinomagnifico/reveal.js-simplemenu) for Reveal.js. Not all of the options in the regular plugin are available in the Quarto plugin.

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
